entry.title: SAP ODdata This page contains the following errors: error on line 1 at column 5105996:
entry.content:
Hello Expert, 

Getting OData URI PROJSet? $skip=0&$top=5000 issue. When I use $top=1000, it works fine; above $top=1000, I get this error. 

Please help.

entry.title: Issue with CDS Join for SD & FI Documents for Custom IRN RAP Application
entry.content:
Hello Expert,

I am working on a custom RAP based Fiori Elements Application for IRN and E-Way Bill Generation. Currently, we generate the IRN using the SD Document Type based on the CDS view I_BillingDocumentBasic.

As per the new requirement, we also need to include FI Documents, so we are using the CDS view I_JournalEntryItem. Our objective is to retrieve DG and DR documents using a UNION ALL, but we are facing an issue where some required fields are not appearing. I have attached a Code of the CDS view which we have  Developed.

Could anyone guide us on what might be causing the join issue or how we can achieve this requirement in our custom IRN application?

We have created two CDS views one is a join of the FI and SD document CDS views, and the another is the Backend CDS view used for IRN Generation where we fetch the Document Type.

Please find the attached First CDS view which has Join logic for both the SD and FI Document CDS views.

@AbapCatalog.viewEnhancementCategory: [#NONE]
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Billing and FICO Document Type Join'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
define view entity ZI_INV_FI_DOC_JOIN
  as select from I_BillingDocumentBasic     as VBRK

    inner join   I_BillingDocumentItemBasic as VBRP on VBRK.BillingDocument = VBRP.BillingDocument
{
  key VBRK.BillingDocument         as BillingDocument,
  key VBRP.BillingDocumentItem     as BillingDocumentItem,
      VBRK.CompanyCode             as CompanyCode,
      VBRK.BillingDocumentType     as BillingDocumentType,
      VBRK.AccountingExchangeRate  as AccountingExchangeRate,
      VBRK.DocumentReferenceID     as DocumentReferenceID,
      VBRK.BillingDocumentDate     as BillingDocumentDate,
      VBRK.CreationDate            as CreationDate,
      VBRK.PayerParty              as Customer,
      @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'TransactionCurrency'
      VBRK.TotalNetAmount          as TotalNetAmount,
      VBRK.TransactionCurrency     as TransactionCurrency,
      VBRP.Plant                   as Plant,
      VBRP.ReferenceSDDocument     as ReferenceSDDocument,
      VBRP.ReferenceSDDocumentItem as ReferenceSDDocumentItem,
      VBRP.Material                as Material,
      @Semantics.quantity.unitOfMeasure: 'BillingQuantityUnit'
      VBRP.BillingQuantity         as BillingQuantity,
      VBRP.BillingQuantityUnit     as BillingQuantityUnit,
      VBRP.BaseUnit                as BaseUnit,
      @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'TransactionCurrency'
      VBRP.NetAmount               as NetAmount
}
union all select from I_JournalEntry     as BKPF
  inner join          I_JournalEntryItem as ACDOCA on BKPF.AccountingDocument = ACDOCA.AccountingDocument
{
  key BKPF.AccountingDocument                             as BillingDocument,
  key cast(ACDOCA.AccountingDocumentItem as abap.char(6)) as BillingDocumentItem,
      BKPF.CompanyCode                                    as CompanyCode,
      BKPF.AccountingDocumentType                         as BillingDocumentType,
      BKPF.ExchangeRate                                   as AccountingExchangeRate,
      BKPF.DocumentReferenceID                            as DocumentReferenceID,
      BKPF. PostingDate                                   as BillingDocumentDate,
      ACDOCA.CreationDate                                 as CreationDate,
      ACDOCA.Customer                                     as Customer,
      ACDOCA.AmountInTransactionCurrency                  as TotalNetAmount,
      ACDOCA.TransactionCurrency                          as TransactionCurrency,
      ACDOCA.Plant                                        as Plant,
      BKPF.DocumentReferenceID                            as ReferenceSDDocument,
      ACDOCA.SourceReferenceDocumentItem                  as ReferenceSDDocumentItem,
      ACDOCA.Product                                      as Material,
      ACDOCA.Quantity                                     as BillingQuantity,
      ACDOCA.ReferenceQuantityUnit                        as BillingQuantityUnit,
      ACDOCA.BaseUnit                                     as BaseUnit,
      ACDOCA.AmountInTransactionCurrency                  as NetAmount
}

 

Here is the another CDS view where we are using this CDS view in the background for fetching the Document Type of SD & FI.

 

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'view entity to pick Invoice number'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
define root view entity ZBR_INV_EDOC_PICK
       with parameters
       iv_fkdat : abap.dats
  as select from    ZI_INV_FI_DOC_JOIN            as _VBRK_BKPF

    left outer join I_ProductText                 as MAKT      on MAKT.Product = _VBRK_BKPF.Material
    left outer join I_Plant                       as t001w     on t001w.Plant = _VBRK_BKPF.Plant
    inner join      I_Customer                    as KNA1      on KNA1.Customer = _VBRK_BKPF.Customer
  
    inner join      ZR_EDOC_TYPE                  as EIDOCTYPE on  EIDOCTYPE.CompanyCode = _VBRK_BKPF.CompanyCode
                                                               and EIDOCTYPE.BillingType = _VBRK_BKPF.BillingDocumentType
  
    inner join      I_ProductPlantBasic           as marc      on  marc.Product = _VBRK_BKPF.Material
                                                               and marc.Plant   = _VBRK_BKPF.Plant
    inner join      I_CompanyCode                 as t001      on t001.CompanyCode = _VBRK_BKPF.CompanyCode
    left outer join I_IN_PlantBusinessPlaceDetail as PBplace   on  PBplace.Plant       = _VBRK_BKPF.Plant
                                                               and PBplace.CompanyCode = _VBRK_BKPF.CompanyCode
    left outer join I_IN_BusinessPlaceTaxDetail   as BBRANCH   on  BBRANCH.CompanyCode   = _VBRK_BKPF.CompanyCode
                                                               and BBRANCH.BusinessPlace = PBplace.BusinessPlace

  association [0..1] to I_Currency      as _TransactionCurrency on $projection.TransactionCurrency = _TransactionCurrency.Currency
  association [0..1] to I_UnitOfMeasure as _BillingQuantityUnit on $projection.BillingQuantityUnit = _BillingQuantityUnit.UnitOfMeasure
{
  key  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingDocument,
  key  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingDocumentItem,
       _VBRK_BKPF.CompanyCode,
       _VBRK_BKPF.BillingDocumentType,
       _VBRK_BKPF.AccountingExchangeRate,
       _VBRK_BKPF.DocumentReferenceID,
       _VBRK_BKPF.BillingDocumentDate,
       _VBRK_BKPF.CreationDate,
       @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'TransactionCurrency'
       _VBRK_BKPF.TotalNetAmount,
       @ObjectModel.foreignKey.association: '_TransactionCurrency'
       _VBRK_BKPF.TransactionCurrency,
       _VBRK_BKPF.Plant,
       _VBRK_BKPF.ReferenceSDDocument,
       _VBRK_BKPF.ReferenceSDDocumentItem,
       _VBRK_BKPF.Material,
       PBplace.BusinessPlace,
       MAKT.ProductName,
       @Semantics.quantity.unitOfMeasure: 'BillingQuantityUnit'
       _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantity,
       @ObjectModel.foreignKey.association: '_BillingQuantityUnit'
       _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit,
       _VBRK_BKPF.BaseUnit,
       @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'TransactionCurrency'
       _VBRK_BKPF.NetAmount,

       LIKP.DeliveryDocument,
       LIKP.ShipToParty,
       LIKP._ShipToParty.BPCustomerName                                                                                                                                             as LBPCustomerName,
       LIKP._ShipToParty.TaxNumber3                                                                                                                                                 as LTaxNumber3,
       LIKP._ShipToParty._AddressDefaultRepresentation.CityName                                                                                                                     as LCityName,
       LIKP._ShipToParty._AddressDefaultRepresentation.DistrictName                                                                                                                 as LDistrictName,
       LIKP._ShipToParty._AddressDefaultRepresentation.PostalCode                                                                                                                   as LPostalCode,
       LIKP._ShipToParty._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetName                                                                                                                   as LCStreetName,
       LIKP._ShipToParty._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetPrefixName1                                                                                                            as LCStreetPrefixName1,
       LIKP._ShipToParty._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetPrefixName2                                                                                                            as LCStreetPrefixName2,
       LIKP._ShipToParty._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetSuffixName1                                                                                                            as LCStreetSuffixName1,
       t001w.PlantName,
       t001w.AddressID                                                                                                                                                              as PAddressID,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.AddresseeFullName,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.StreetName,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.CityName,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.DistrictName,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.PostalCode,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.StreetPrefixName1,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.StreetPrefixName2,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.StreetSuffixName1,
       BBRANCH.IN_GSTIdentificationNumber,
       KNA1.Customer,
       KNA1.BPCustomerName,
       KNA1.AddressID                                                                                                                                                               as CAddressID,
       KNA1.TaxNumber3                                                                                                                                                              as CTaxNumber3,
       KNA1._AddressDefaultRepresentation.CityName                                                                                                                                  as CCityName,
       KNA1._AddressDefaultRepresentation.DistrictName                                                                                                                              as CDistrictName,
       KNA1._AddressDefaultRepresentation.PostalCode                                                                                                                                as CPostalCode,
       KNA1._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetName                                                                                                                                as CStreetName,
       KNA1._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetPrefixName1                                                                                                                         as CStreetPrefixName1,
       KNA1._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetPrefixName2                                                                                                                         as CStreetPrefixName2,
       KNA1._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetSuffixName1                                                                                                                         as CStreetSuffixName1,
       t001.CompanyCodeName,
       t001.AddressID                                                                                                                                                               as CCAddressID,
       t001._OrgAddressDefaultRprstn.CityName                                                                                                                                       as CCCityName,
       t001._OrgAddressDefaultRprstn.PostalCode                                                                                                                                     as CCPostalCode,
       t001._OrgAddressDefaultRprstn.StreetName                                                                                                                                     as CCStreetName,
       t001._OrgAddressDefaultRprstn.StreetPrefixName1                                                                                                                              as CCStreetPrefixName1,
       t001._OrgAddressDefaultRprstn.StreetPrefixName2                                                                                                                              as CCStreetPrefixName2,
       t001._OrgAddressDefaultRprstn.StreetSuffixName1                                                                                                                              as CCStreetSuffixName1,
       BBRANCH.IN_GSTIdentificationNumber                                                                                                                                           as CCGSTIN,
       EIDOCTYPE.BillingType,
       EIDOCTYPE.InvoiceType,
       EIDOCTYPE.IrnDocType,
       EIDOCTYPE.SupplyType,
       EIDOCTYPE.IrnApp,
       EIDOCTYPE.EwbApp,
       EIDOCTYPE.EwbDocType,
       EIDOCTYPE.ProcessType,

       _VBRK_BKPF.AccountingExchangeRate *  _VBRK_BKPF.AccountingExchangeRate                                                                                                       as exrate,
       @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'TransactionCurrency'
       cast ( cast (  _VBRK_BKPF.NetAmount as abap.dec( 15, 5 ) ) *  _VBRK_BKPF.AccountingExchangeRate as abap.curr(15,2) )                                                         as taxvalue,
       @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'TransactionCurrency'
       cast ( cast (  _VBRK_BKPF.NetAmount as abap.dec( 15, 5 ) ) *  _VBRK_BKPF.AccountingExchangeRate / cast( _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantity as abap.dec(13,5) )  as abap.curr(15,2 )) as unitprice,
       marc.ConsumptionTaxCtrlCode,
       case
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'kg'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit  = 'KG'
       then 'KGS'
       when _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'ea'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'EA'
       then 'NOS'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'pc'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'PC'
         or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'st'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'ST'
       then 'PCS'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'dr'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'DR'
       then 'DRM'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'ft2' or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'FT2'
       then 'SQF'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'g'   or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'G'
       then 'GMS'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'm2'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'M2'
       then 'SQM'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'm3'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'M3'
       then 'CBM'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'ml'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'ML'
       then 'MLT'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'paa' or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'PAA'
       then 'PRS'
       else 'OTH'
       end                                                                                                                                                                          as zunit,
       _TransactionCurrency,
       _BillingQuantityUnit
}
where
  _VBRK_BKPF.CreationDate = $parameters.iv_fkdat

 

Thank you,

entry.title: Re: Unable to change status of an order to not relevant
entry.content:
Dear @Suvarna4,

The only supported ways to keep it out of Create Billing Documents (F0798) are:

  1. Delete the sales order (not possible here because you already had a billing document) or
  2. Reject all billing-relevant items with a rejection reason that has “No Billing” = ON in config.

Check in CBC:

  1. Configuration step Define Reasons for Rejection (102494)
  2. For the rejection reason you want to use (for example Order Cancelled due to Error)

 

    • Flag No Billing = ticked
      • This is what actually makes the items not copied to billing and removes them from the Create Billing Documents due list.

More details below:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3152233

If No Billing is not ticked, even a fully rejected order will still appear in the billing due list this is exactly what SAP Note’s 3102794 and 3471934 describe.

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3102794

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3471934

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: Re: How to connect with SAP S/4HANA OData Services from SAP APIM? - OAuth 2.0 Based Authentication
entry.content:
@gabrielalberto_stein86

Let me assure you, it is extremely easy to implement. If you happen to have any questions, please feel free to reach out to me. 
The <Get> operation retrieves values from a Key Value Map (KVM), which I have created, called SAP_S4HANA_Credentials which has the Key as Username andPassword. 
usernameFromKVM is a private variable in your API proxy execution context. It holds the value of the Username key from the Key Value MapSAP_S4HANA_Credentials.
The prefix private. means the variable is scoped to the current flow execution and not exposed outside.


In short, usernameFromKVM is the variable that stores the SAP S/4HANA username retrieved from the Key Value Map SAP_S4HANA_Credentials. It’s used later in your API proxy for authentication or connection setup.

entry.title: Integration Suite Cloud Connector Connectivity Test fails
entry.content:
I'm trying to set up Cloud Connector to my BTP and Integration Suite so I can access SMB shares on an internal Windows 11 server.

Everything I can see the status of, looks like everything is working except it seems Integration Suite isn't talking to BTP,  maybe.

Here are screenshots of everything I have running.

Cloud Connector on Windows Machine

This windows machine has confirmed access to the SMB file share I want to get files from.

Tested in PowerShell and basic authentication user name and password are verified working.

 

Status of that cloud connector

 Status of connection in BTP

I set up a "Destination" in BTP as a test as well just to see and that checks out.

But, now In integration suite if I try and use this in a SMB Adapter in an iFlow I get errors (some details obscured, my company is very sensitive)

All of the parameters are 100% correct (as long as this is what is supposed to go there).

Address is the virtual address I have set up.

Location ID is the Location ID is have set up in Cloud Connector on the Windows Machine

Share is the name of the Share Drive I'm trying to access via SMB on the Windows Machine

Credentials Name is set up and deployed and verified as correct username and password that can access the SMB share at the destination.

"org.apache.camel.CamelException: <Exception><Message>Error in Session connect: On-Premise connection failed for bXX-XXX:445. Ensure cloud connector is configured correctly for location id : us-XXX-XXX and host is exposed correctly in your cloud connector. SMB uses TCP as protocol. Error : SOCKS5 command failed with status: NETWORK_UNREACHABLE</Message></Exception>"

Also, in Integration Suite, if I go to "Monitor->Manage Security->Connectivity Tests->Cloud Connector"

and put in my location ID the only feedback I get is "Could not connect to Cloud Connector" error.

Not sure how to proceed to try and get this working.

entry.title: Scale Pricing in Sales Based on Characteristic Value
entry.content:
Good evening,

Is it possible to do scale pricing (VK11) based on the value of a characteristic in the variant configurator in the sales order?

For example, the customer pays a fixed rate per size interval.

100-999 mm = €100

1000-1999mm = €175

2000-2500mm = €170.

In the variant configurator, we have the characteristic PRODUCT_SIZE, this is a field in which any value between 100 and 2500mm can be filled, to determine the product size. From a pricing point of view, the product size falls within one of the intervals above.

How can we make sure the correct sales price is selected based on the interval in which the value for PRODUCT_SIZE falls?

Is it possible to combine this with tier pricing/scales?

Thanks in advance,

Floyd

entry.title: Re: Importing Employee photo from external third party
entry.content: I used Integration Center to schedule a daily job that reads URLs from a custom MDF object and updates the employee photos using an FTP connection without needing to download them manually.

entry.title: Re: How to connect with SAP S/4HANA OData Services from SAP APIM? - OAuth 2.0 Based Authentication
entry.content:
@gabrielalberto_stein86 

Let me assure you, it is extremely easy to implement. If you happen to have any questions, please feel free to reach out to me. 
The <Get> operation retrieves values from a Key Value Map (KVM), which I have created, called SAP_S4HANA_Credentials which has the Key as Username andPassword. 
usernameFromKVM is a private variable in your API proxy execution context. It holds the value of the Username key from the Key Value MapSAP_S4HANA_Credentials.
The prefix private. means the variable is scoped to the current flow execution and not exposed outside.


In short, usernameFromKVM is the variable that stores the SAP S/4HANA username retrieved from the Key Value Map SAP_S4HANA_Credentials. It’s used later in your API proxy for authentication or connection setup.

usernameFromKVM is a private variable in your API proxy execution context. It holds the value of the Username key from the Key Value MapSAP_S4HANA_Credentials.

In short, usernameFromKVM is the variable that stores the SAP S/4HANA username retrieved from the Key Value Map SAP_S4HANA_Credentials. It’s used later in your API proxy for authentication or connection setup.

entry.title: SAP Ariba SLP - MDG attachment Integration - Making the Impossible Possible
entry.content:
The integration between SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance (SLP) and SAP Master Data Governance for Suppliers (MDG-S) enables extensive synchronization of supplier master data across both systems through choreographed business scenarios. The SLP-MDG integration supports bidirectional data exchange between SAP Ariba SLP and MDG-S, ensuring consistent supplier master data across both applications. If you would like to know the supported scenarios within this integration, refer to the standard documentation here

In this section, we will cover the details of integrating attachments from Ariba SLP into SAP MDG or SAP ERP systems.  Let's first discuss the potential documents a supplier will upload to Ariba SLP when they register or update their existing registration. 

  • Quality and other Certificates
  • Tax and Financial Documents
  • Supporting Documents that the buyer wants the supplier to upload
  • Contractual or Risk documents

Attachments in Ariba SLP are not restricted to the above documents it could be any Ariba acceptable format that pass the inbuilt Virus test while uploading on the SAP Business Network for Suppliers (which is the UI for the Supplier when trying to register to a Buyer's SLP) 

Secondly, attachment-related inputs can be collected in the Registration, Modular, and Qualification Questionnaire. The SAP Ariba SLP product team recommends receiving certifications with Validity dates through Modular questionnaires only. 

Lastly, Questionnaire respondents can add attachments to a supplier management questionnaire as a response to any of the following questions:

  • Answer type of Attachment.

  • Answer type of Certificate, where one of the certificate detail fields is an attachment field.

  • Any other answer type, with Participant can add additional comments and attachments set to Yes

In the first two cases, the attachment is a direct answer to the question. In the third case, the attachment is an optional addition to the response and can be added with or without a comment. For more details about the attachment sizes supported refer to the help documentation here.

Our Solution: A Dedicated Integration Package for Attachments

Given the context above, customers seeking attachment integration typically fall into two categories:

  1. Existing Users: Customers already live with the standard SAP Ariba SLP integration (via SAP Integration Suite, Managed Gateway for Spend and Business Network/CIG).

  2. New Implementations: Customers planning or currently implementing the standard SAP SLP-MDG/ERP integration through CIG.

Why This Package is Essential

Our integration package is designed to work for both customer groups because it does not disrupt the standard SAP Ariba CIG integration for Supplier Data Integration.

Instead, we leverage SAP Ariba's open APIs and standard SAP MDG APIs, making the package highly consumable, robust, and extensible for future scenarios. We strongly recommend that customers first implement the standard CIG-based integration for core vendor master data integration and then utilize this package to seamlessly supplement it with attachment integration.

Let's now take a look at the architecture at a high level to see how to achieve this.

High-Level Architecture

The integration package, which we have developed and deployed for customers, operates on a continuous polling mechanism:

  1. It checks SAP Ariba SLP at regular intervals for the latest created and changed suppliers.

  2. It identifies suppliers that are Approved and have a Registered status.

  3. Using SAP Ariba Open APIs, it securely transfers the attachments from the questionnaires to the target system (SAP MDG or SAP ERP), which is configurable based on customer requirements.

  4. The package includes the necessary ABAP code to accurately add the attachment to the SAP MDG Change Request or the SAP ERP Business Partner record.

Benefits of deploying this integration package for the Ariba SLP → SAP MDG / SAP ERP BP Attachment Integration would be,

  • Fully automated attachment flow, zero manual intervention
  • Reduced onboarding cycle time, Accelerates Supplier Onboarding
  • Lower administrative overhead for Supplier Management teams in Customers
  • More consistent and complete supplier records, strengthening compliance and Auditability
  • Enhances Data Quality and Governance
  • Supports Multiple Integration Scenarios (Both SAP MDG and SAP ERP systems)

Customers have reported a 40-60% reduction in manual effort during supplier onboarding, based on the volume of attachments they handle. 

If you have any further questions, please leave a comment below or send your inquiries to the email CoE_AI_PlanningSpendExec@global.corp.sap. We will be happy to get back to you.

entry.title: How does the Inventory Audit Report calculation work in SAP Business One?
entry.content:
Hello!

I am studying in depth how SAP Business One calculates and “freezes” quantities and values in the Inventory Audit Report.

I would like to understand what happens behind the scenes, specifically:

1. How does SAP “lock” the quantity on a past date?
When I generate the report for a specific date (for example: 2024-10-30), it returns exactly the quantity I had in each warehouse on that date.

I would like to understand:

Which tables and fields does SAP use to reconstruct this historical stock balance?

Does it recalculate everything transaction by transaction, or is there any kind of snapshot?

Is there a table that stores frozen quantities, or is everything derived from historical documents only?

2. How does the system determine which items to include?
Does it include all items that had movements before the selected date?

Or only items with a non-zero balance?

entry.title: SAP Champions
entry.content:
Who are SAP Champions?

SAP Champions are:

  • Proactive volunteers with a passion for SAP technologies.
  • Top contributors, leaders, and organizers within the SAP ecosystem.
  • Advocates of SAP communities.
  • Hands-on experts of an SAP product, service, and/or topics.

What do SAP Champions do?

SAP Champions help the SAP Community and its members:

  • Guide and support new members to help them get the most out of their community experience.
  • Share insights and expertise via blog posts, answering questions, drive or contribute to SAP Community group discussions.
  • Lead local SAP Community driven events such as an informal meetup or SAP Inside Track.

What is the difference between the SAP Champions and SAP Mentors programs?

The SAP Mentors share their knowledge and experience to SAP executives and product teams.
This provides an outside -> in view.
The SAP Champions advocate for SAP and SAP Community. They support us to share key messaging and to help drive software adoption in their networks.
This provides an inside -> out view.

Contact us

Looking for more information? For questions and comments about the SAP Champions, please contact sapchampions@sap.com.

Submit a nomination

SAP Champions can be nominated or self-nominated.
Nominated can include being approached proactively by the Community Programs team.
The selection process takes place by the community team, in cycles.

For more information, please contact sapchampions@sap.com.

What makes a great SAP Champion?

  • Top contributor: SAP Champions are top contributors to the SAP Community and ecosystem, serving as distinguished leaders and upholding community ideals and spirit. Traits include being a top influencer, leader, and organizer.
  • Advocate: Advocates and representatives of SAP communities – whether through community.sap.com, related sites, social media, or in-person events. They demonstrate passion in everything they do, and inspire others to be like them.
  • Active SAP Community member: Must be a member of SAP Community for a minimum of one full year with an active membership, a profile with a recognizable display name, and featuring a photo.
    Have a robust reputation across SAP Community, including active participation in SAP Community groups (including location groups), questions and answers, blog posts and comments, and events.
  • Expert: Hands-on experts of an SAP product(s), service(s), and/or topic(s).
  • Professional: The span of membership must be marked with positive behavior and adherence to the community rules of engagement. The member's interactions with others must always be polite, friendly, and supportive; this extends to social media and both virtual and in-person events.
  • Continuous Learner: Someone who stays up-to-date and innovates.
  • Events-driven: Due to our renewed focus on events, in the previous one-year period, the member should have participated in several events including both online and in-person – this includes hosting/speaking/attending.
  • Well-connected: Have a strong network and reputation across external sites/channels – for example, LinkedIn.
  • Eligibility: Anyone not employed by an SAP competitor is eligible for the SAP Champions program. SAP Champions, however, may not be a member of an existing influencer program (e.g., SAP Mentors) or a special council dedicated to community strategy or activity.

Further resources

  • Current SAP Champions – meet our amazing community leaders!
  • Become an Event Organizer – for those interested, this guide is useful for those with a passion for proactively nurturing a local community.

entry.title: Re: SAP Enable Now: I cannot save and delete a context help in Manager and Producer
entry.content:
Similar post 9 months ago How to resolve the "Save Failed" error in SAP Web ... - SAP Community   , I would guess you (or someone) is still editing it in the Fiori interface, which is where you normally edit Companion content anyway. In Manager, locate that object and see who has the object out for edit. If it's not you, Cancel Editing. If it is you, then I would recommend going to that screen in Fiori and seeing if you can edit it, then Save and Publish your changes, then leave the Edit mode and navigate away from the screen. That should release the write token. Then check Manager and refresh the screen to see if the object is Finished Editing, which it should be. 

If all else fails, I would Cancel Editing on the object in Manager and then see if you can edit it again in Fiori.

entry.title: Re: Planned Values in Cost based POC method of RA
entry.content: You can use standard RA configuration.  You are correct, choose Valuation Basis = S.  Then as actuals go over the planned costs it will use the actuals as the cost basis.  You will never go over 100% POC.

entry.title: Re: Forcing re-authentication into SuccessFators after ce...
entry.content:
Hello @katje_28 ,

At SAP SuccessFactors level it is possible to set a specific timeout period for users session. 

 The available configuration can be adjusted in provisioning, as per below:

  • Inactivity Time Before Session Timeout. Set the number of minutes, up to 30 minutes maximum, that a session can remain inactive before it expires. The default is 30 minutes.
    • By default, users will achieve timeout after 30 minutes without activity.
  • Warning Time Before Session Timeout. Set the number of minutes prior to timeout that a warning is displayed. The default is 10 minutes. If the configured value is greater than or equal to the Inactivity Time, the default value is used. 

Kindly note that,  the customized timeout period is only considered if there is at least one SuccessFactors tab open in the browser. Without any active SuccessFactors tab open the default 30 minute timeout will be considered.

If you don't have access to provisioning, you can open a SAP ticket under the component LOD-SF-PLT-PRVR.

To know more about this feature, please refer to KBA 2088893 - How to define the Session timeout period and timeout warning period for SuccessFactors Platform

Hope this can assist you on your query.

All the best,
Camila

entry.title: Re: Birthday Card
entry.content:
Hi @esinanya ,

Currently, SAP SuccessFactors birthday cards can only be enabled for managers via role-based permission, so manager will have access to the data of all their subordinates. Due to that, there ins't a way to restrict birthday cards to be displayed in case one specific employee does not want to share this data. The job will run and share the information for the manager of all their subordinates (as per configured in the RBP role used).

Documents for reference:

  • KBA 3116231 - Birthday and Work Anniversary Cards on the Home Page
  • KBA 3152871 - Prerequisites for showing Birthday and Work Anniversary cards in latest Homepage

If you would like to have this functionality included in a future release you can create an enhancement request, as per KBA 2090228. 

All the best,
Camila

entry.title: Project Progress Monitoring Tools
entry.content:
Hi All,

In a project's supply chain, it's crucial to know the different stages of progress for the project's requirements at all times. Specifically, it's important to know if:
- there are materials allocated in a project with Purchase Requisitions (PRs), but no Purchase Orders (POs).

- materials allocated in a project with PRs and POs and their corresponding confirmed delivery dates.

- materials allocated in a project, with POs that already have materials in transit.
- materials with POs that have been delivered, already have Goods Receipt (GR), and are in project stock (since when?).

- materials that have been received and supplied to the customer/project site, in what quantities, and on what dates.

 

Do you know how to monitor project progress in this way? with which report?

Do you know how to view supply chain information for multiple projects managed by the same supply chain supporting person? with which report?

Is there a report that can used to get some Supply chain performance KPIs for the corresponding evaluation?

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Infoset Field Length Limit
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am working with InfoSets for the 1st time, and need some guidance. My requirement is to fetch particular fields from the QMEL table and include a text field which will fetch data from the READ_TEXT function module.

Creating a new InfoSet via SQ02, I have added the QMEL table as a field group and have declared a variable LONGTEXT of type char, specifying length of 999 (as the text from READ_TEXT is touching close to 800-900 characters) The variable can only be defined as a pre-defined type in the InfoSet, so STRING is out of the question as well (although I would appreciate if someone could tell me if and how it would be possible).

However, even after concatenating the lines from READ_TEXT into my LONGTEXT variable and exporting into a spreadsheet, the data is only being displayed till 255 characters. The rest is being truncated.

I thought of an approach to declare multiple variables and start populating each one till it reaches 255 characters, then split the text into the next variable, and so on. However, that will create multiple columns in the spreadsheet and is not being accepted by the reviewers.

I have attached the screenshots of my data declaration and custom code as well.

Is there any way that I can approach this requirement without going for a custom program?

Thanks in advance,

Amar

Field Declaration

 

Code for the custom field

entry.title: Progressive OJT Confirmation with one or multiple Observers
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

  • In a regulated and validated environment where activities must be documented in real time, how do you manage OJT (On-the-Job Training) confirmation during operations?
  • Key constraints:
    • Training follows the operational schedule.
    • Availability of qualified observers and the trainee.
    • Completion of OJT tasks may span several days or even weeks.
  • With the current version of LMS:
    • There is an option to progressively save task completion, but the signature can only be applied once for all tasks at the end.
    • If another observer opens the OJT, they cannot see what has already been confirmed by the previous observer; they start from scratch.
  • Desired system behavior:
    • An OJT may require multiple observers.
    • Each observer can validate only the tasks they supervised.
    • The last observer can view the observations made by colleagues within the OJT and sign their part at the end.
  • Questions :
    1. How do you manage progressive OJT confirmation in this context?
    2. How do you handle situations where multiple observers are involved in the same OJT?
    3. Have you successfully implemented other improvements for managing OJT completion in your LMS?

Thank you in advance for your feedback and for sharing your experience!

entry.title: Re: US PAYROLL - /N Series Technical Wagetypes
entry.content:
Hello Vivekasri, 

The /N series wage types usually refer to scenarios involving insufficient funds. These wage types represent various deductions that could not be taken because the employee's net pay was not sufficient to cover them.

For instance, wage type /N01, according to the documentation, represents the withholding tax calculated by BSI but not taken due to insufficient funds.

You can find more detailed information about specific /N wage types by checking the V_512W_D view, which contains documentation for various wage types used in SAP HCM Payroll.

These wage types are generated during the payroll run when the system identifies that the employee's net pay is inadequate to cover certain deductions. This process ensures that payroll calculations are accurate and that any discrepancies are clearly documented.

If you have any specific questions please feel free to ask. 

Best regards, 
Ana Falcão
HCM NA Developer

entry.title: How To Select The Correct Print Queue Based on Work Center in Output Control
entry.content:
It is necessary to ensure that the Handling Unit (HU) label printout is sent to the appropriate printer, considering that multiple printers may be used for HU label printing. The printer selection should occur automatically based on predefined conditions.

How can the correct printer be identified so that the HU label is printed on the device located closest to the final work center of the production order?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How To Select The Correct Print Queue Based on Work C...
entry.content:
A suitable approach is to incorporate additional decision rules within Output Parameter Determination. To obtain the intended behavior, the following design can be used:

1. Capture the last work center on the HU or a related object:
A field is required on the Handling Unit (or on an associated item or packaging object) that stores the last work center in which the HU was processed. If such a field is not available in the standard structure, it may be necessary to create it through Key User Extensibility using the Custom Fields and Custom Logic applications. If the HU header does not contain this information, the determination logic cannot operate as expected.

2. Configure the Output Parameter Determination decision table:
In the Output Parameter Determination application (application: Handling Unit; determination step: Printer Settings), the work center—either a standard field or a custom field—should be added as a condition column.
Decision rules can then be maintained, for example:
– If Work Center = A → Printer = Print_Queue_A
– If Work Center = B → Printer = Print_Queue_B

Corresponding rules should be created for all relevant work centers, with these entries placed at the top of the decision table and set as exclusive to ensure that only the first matching rule is applied.

entry.title: Understanding Seamless Planning
entry.content:
Introduction to Seamless Planning  

Seamless Planning is a new integration paradigm between SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) and SAP Datasphere that unifies planning logic with enterprise-grade data storage and governance. It allows SAC to remain the planning experience and calculation engine while Datasphere becomes the authoritative and governed persistence layer for plan data and master data. This means planning teams can reuse planning data across analytics, data transformation pipelines, and operational applications—without duplicating or exporting data outside of SAC. Modelers can build SAC planning models that physically store their transactional data and public dimensions inside Datasphere. They also have control over whether planning artifacts from SAC are exposed in Datasphere for reuse across Spaces or downstream analytic models.

Technical Architecture

  • Model Metadata & Planning Logic: Planning calculations, version management, and data actions remain defined inside SAC.
  • Fact Data & Dimensions Stored in Datasphere: The planning model’s fact tables and public dimensions are persisted in Datasphere to enable governed reuse and enterprise distribution.
  • Data Exposure from SAC to Datasphere: SAC can expose selected planning objects as read-only Datasphere artifacts, enabling modelers to use these objects in Data Builder or transform them into Analytical Models.

Key Benefits

  • Unified Planning Data: Centralized storage of plan facts and dimensions in Datasphere ensures consistency across systems and workflows.
  • Direct Persistence to Datasphere: Changes made in SAC planning flows are instantly reflected in Datasphere fact tables—no manual exports required.
  • Optimized SAC Resource Usage: Offloading data storage to Datasphere reduces SAC’s memory and storage footprint.
  • Enterprise Reusability & Governance: Datasphere’s modeling and transformation extend to planning data, enabling secure and scalable reuse in the form of analytic models.

This approach eliminates data silos, reduces duplication, and empowers organizations to operationalize planning data across their digital landscape—while preserving SAC’s rich planning experience at the front end.

Prerequisites for Seamless Planning

Before configuring or deploying planning models from SAC to Datasphere, ensure the following system prerequisites are met.

  1. SAC Tenant Must Be Running on SAP HANA Cloud
    • SAC must be provisioned on SAP HANA Cloud infrastructure.
    • To verify: Navigate to System → About in SAC and confirm the HANA Cloud version is listed.
    • This ensures compatibility with Datasphere’s storage and modeling architecture.

 2.  Tenant Co-Location and 1:1 Linkage

  • Both SAC and Datasphere tenants must reside in the same SAP data center region.
  • A 1:1 tenant relationship is required—each SAC tenant must be linked to a single Datasphere tenant.
  • This linkage enables SAC to persist planning data directly into Datasphere spaces.
  • This can be done in System à Administration à Tenant Links in both SAP Analytics Cloud and SAP Datasphere.

3. Consistent Identity Provider (IdP) Configuration

  • It is strongly recommended that both tenants use the same SAML-based Identity Provider (IdP).
  • This ensures consistent user identity mapping across SAC and Datasphere.

4. System Owner Credentials on Both Tenants

  • The tenant linkage process requires authentication using a system owner account on both SAC and Datasphere.
  • This account must have administrative privileges to authorize cross-tenant integration.

5. User Role Assignment in Datasphere Space

    • SAC users who need to create, edit, or expose planning models must be granted appropriate space-level roles in Datasphere.
    • Without these roles, SAC will not be able to write data or expose model objects to the designated Datasphere space.

If any of the above conditions are not met, then Datasphere will not appear as a selectable data storage location in SAC. The  SAP Knowledge Base Article 3515100 highlights certain errors along with their corresponding workarounds.

Workflow for Seamless Planning

  1. Create a New Model in SAC: While creating a new Model in SAC, there is an option available to specify the Data Storage Location as a Space within SAP Datasphere.

2. Configure Dimensions and Measures:  The model created with Datasphere persistence layer is created as a Planning Measure based model by default and the data storage location is Datasphere Space as shown in model details.

3. Expose to Datasphere: There is also an additional option in the Model Details to expose the underlying fact table in the chosen Datasphere space. What gets created in Datasphere: When a SAC planning model is configured to store data in Datasphere:

4. What gets created in Datasphere: When a SAC planning model is configured to store data in Datasphere:

  • A Fact object (read-only) becomes visible in the Datasphere Space.
  • A corresponding physical table (sap.sac.<GUID>) is created to store transactional planning data.
  • Any public dimensions used in the model are created in Datasphere as dimension tables and remain shareable across Space.

5. Execute Planning scenarios in SAC: With the new model now exposed in Datasphere, key planning scenarios can continue to be executed within SAC exactly as before. Seamless Planning does not alter the way SAC planning processes run; it simply extends the option to persist and integrate data through Datasphere while maintaining the familiar SAC planning experience.

  • Create and Execute a Data Action: Develop a Data Action in SAC to update planning data. Once executed, publish the updated data back to Datasphere to ensure synchronization across platforms.
  • Conduct Actual vs Plan Analysis: Utilize SAC's analytical capabilities to compare actual performance against planned figures. This enables variance analysis and supports informed decision-making.
  • Extend Modelling in Datasphere: Build custom calculations directly within SAP Datasphere using the exposed model. Create a dedicated view and Analytical Model on top of these calculations, then visualize the results seamlessly in SAC for enhanced planning insights.

Important Considerations

SAP is actively working to reduce the space dependency in future releases, for latest updates please refer the SAP Roadmap Explorer and the help guide.

  • Cross-Model Planning Constraints: Currently all models involved in cross-model planning operations—such as a data action, cross-model copy step must be in the same Datasphere space.
  • Shared Public Dimensions:  Sharing public dimensions across multiple models is only supported when both the models and the associated public dimensions are deployed within the same SAP Datasphere space. The same requirement applies to currency rate tables, which must reside in the same space to be referenced across models.
  • Hierarchies:  Hierarchies defined in SAP Analytics Cloud are not exposed to SAP Datasphere. If hierarchical structures are required for modeling or reporting, Datasphere modelers must reconstruct these hierarchies natively within Datasphere, ensuring alignment with the underlying data model and semantic layer.

Seamless Planning in BDC

SAP is introducing a unified enterprise planning paradigm through SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC). This represents the next stage in the evolution of Seamless Planning, where planning activities are connected, real-time, and driven by trusted operational data—eliminating the traditional “export, transform, and import” workflow. Because SAC and Datasphere are core components of BDC, seamless planning is highly relevant in this context and establishes the foundation for deep integration of planning data within the BDC environment. Looking ahead, BDC has the potential to further enrich seamless planning by:

  • Supporting planning-enabled intelligent applications that combine analytics with actionable planning workflows.
  • Extending planning architectures to include platforms such as SAP Databricks.
  • Enabling the consumption of data products directly within planning processes, ensuring governed, reusable, and scalable planning assets.

To understand Seamless Planning in context of Business Data Cloud, please refer to this blog.

entry.title: Re: Visual Studio 2022 Crystal Report multiple tables
entry.content:
Can you type in "winver" in the Search window, what is the current version you upgraded to?

Does the Report work in Crystal Reports Designer?

If so click on Database and then Verify and see if that helps?

Are you connecting to the Database or using a DataSet?

It could be a permission issue, try starting Visual Studio or your project by right clicking on the EXE and select Run As Administrator.

Sounds like it's a linking issue...

Report the issue to Sage and Microsoft and see if they can determine to root of the issue...

entry.title: Re: CR not integrating in Visual Studio 2026
entry.content: Don, thank for the information and your efforts to get it.

entry.title: Re: Error Message: Error in File ~tmp3e00d40bd1a7740.rpt:...
entry.content:
Due to the nature of dll's they are not capable of returning the actual error from deep down, it's only the top layer that can report the error. As Ido is suggesting it's likely due to either too much data or the Server is too busy to manage all of the DB connections. Each report and subreports per main report filtering will make a separate connection to the DB. For example if the main report returns 100 results for the subreport there will be 100 connection to the dB server. Remember CR is a Reporting tool, it's not a database archiving tool....

Another option is to add more filtering server side using Stored Procedures so not so much data is being returned and expecting CR to do the filtering client side....

entry.title: Incorrect behavior during White List verification after payment proposal
entry.content:
After executing a payment proposal in transaction F110, the SAP S/4HANA system verifies vendor data against the Polish VAT White List and the following issues occur:

  1. The system finds a bank account that is not listed on the White List.

    • Error message:
      VAT Payers List (Poland), bank account validation 0001: Does not exist on the White List.

entry.title: Re: Actual Cost Accounting and Moving Average Cost
entry.content: Good morning , i think i understood your question . if the product is using standard price , this standard price will never change unless you do the cost estimate for it (CK40N/CK11N) . for example there is a raw material A , a raw material B , and a finished product C . BOM of finished product C is : C(1pc) = A(1pc) + B(1pc) . C and A is using standard price , B is using moving average price . after the first cost estimate for C and A , the standard price of them is : C = 100 JPY/pc , A = 80 JPY/pc , this time the moving average price of B is 20 JPY/pc . then later , moving average price of B will change when you do the goods receipt with different price , but A and C will not change because no cost estimate(CK40N/CK11N) happened . after 1 month , standard price of A and C is not changed , moving average price of B become 30 JPY/pc . if you do the cost estimate (CK40N/CK11N) for C again , then the standard price of C will become 110 JPY/pc = 80 JPY/pc (A) + 30 JPY/pc (B) .

entry.title: Re: Crystal Reports running extremely slow in SAGE after...
entry.content:
I suggest contacting Sage to see if they can duplicate the issue and possibly enabling logging to see what the cause may be.

If you search for CRLogger you can enable Crystal Reports database logging component, it may help debug the slow down.

It could be permissions also, runt the Sage App by right clicking on the EXE and selecting Run As Administrator.
